key_points: JBS USA paid $11 million in Bitcoin to cybercriminals after a ransomware attack.
The attack temporarily shut down JBS processing plants, impacting US meat production.
Andre Nogueira, CEO of JBS USA, stated the payment was made to avoid further disruption.
The ransomware attack highlighted the vulnerability of the US's critical infrastructure.
JBS's servers in the US and Australia were targeted, possibly by a criminal group based in Russia.
No company, customer, or employee data was reportedly compromised in the attack.
The FBI is investigating the incident, emphasizing its seriousness.
The White House is engaging with the Russian government regarding the attack.
President Biden is expected to discuss concerns over cyberattacks with Russian President Putin.
The attack on JBS followed a similar incident that targeted the Colonial Pipeline.
spokespersons: Karine Jean-Pierre (Deputy Press Secretary, White House)
